item.name: Amulet of Extraordinary Wisdom
entries: While wearing this amulet, your Wisdom score and Wisdom score maximum increases by 3.

item.name: Blixt
entries: This staff is made of pure copper. Its end points look like they were exposed to intense heat.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The staff functions as a {@item +2 quarterstaff}.

When you hit with a melee attack using this staff, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pushed in a straight line up to 15 feet away from you.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once Blixt reaches an exalted state, it gains the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to lightning damage.
The staff becomes a {@item +3 quarterstaff}.
You can use the staff as a spellcasting focus and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attacks and spell saving throw DCs.
The staff has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} charges daily at dawn.
Call Lightning. As an action, you can cast {@spell call lightning} without needing to concentrate on it. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.
Lightning Strike. When you cast a spell, you can expend 2 charges to deal {@damage 3d6} lightning damage to one creature the spell is affecting.

Surge of Sorcery (requires attunement by a sorcerer). As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges and instantly regain 5 sorcery points. When you use this feature roll a [@dice d4}, on a 1, roll on the sorcerer's wild magic surge table

Storm Sorcery (requires attunement by a sorcerer). When you use a Metamagic option on a spell, you can expend 1 charge and immediately fly up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks and cause each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you to take {@damage 2d4} lightning damage.

item.name: Bracelet of Outstanding Charisma
entries: While wearing this amulet, your Charisma score and Charisma score maximum increases by 3.

item.name: Cloak of Stepping
entries: This cloak has 6 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3+3} expended charges daily at dawn. Wile wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action and expend 1 charge of the cloak to cast {@spell misty step} or you can use an action and expend 2 charges of the cloak to cast {@spell thunder step|XGE}.

item.name: Cloak of the Mole
entries: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you have a burrowing speed of 30 feet and tremorsense out to 10 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

item.name: Crown of the Forgotten
entries: This cloaks appears to be made out of leaves with elderberries sprinkled all over it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The crown functions as a {@item +1 rod of the pact keeper}.

When you cast a warlock spell while wearing the crown, you can cause a slimy tentacle to rip through the fabric of reality and strike one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once the Crown of the Forgotten reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The crown becomes a {@item +2 rod of the pact keeper}.
You gain resistance to psychic damage.
The crown has 9 charges and regains {@dice 2d4+1} charges daily at dawn.

Crown of Madness. As an action, you can cast {@spell crown of madness} without needing to concentrate on it and you can maintain control as a bonus action. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.

Mystic Regeneration. As a bonus action, you can regain one use of your Mystic Arcanum feature. When you do so, you must expand a number of charges equal to the spell level of the regained mystic arcanum.
Eldritch Ward When you use your Mystic Arcanum feature, you can expand 2 charge and gain temporary hit points equal to the level of your mystic arcanum times your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Drunkards Bottle
entries: This bottle looks like an oversized clay bottle with a bronze strap around it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The bottle functions as an {@item insignia of claws|HotDQ}. As an action, you can expend 2 ki points, take a deep sip and exhale a breath weapon. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity or a Constitution saving throw (your choice) against your Ki save DC.
If you choose the Dexterity save, on a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage or half as much damage on a successful one.
If you choose the Constitution save, on a failed save, a creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once the bottle reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The bottle becomes a {@item insignia of claws|HotDQ|+2 insignia of claws}.
You gain resistance to acid damage.
The bottle has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

Intellect Fortress. As an action, you can cast {@spell intellect fortress|TCE} on you without needing to concentrate on it, but it only lasts for 1 minute. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.
Deep Breathing. As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges and instantly regain 4 ki points.

Numbing Blow. When you use your Flurry of Blows feature, you can expend one charge on either of the unarmed strikes and give your target disadvantage on its next attack roll or dexterity saving throw.

item.name: Eldfjall
entries: This maul is warm to the touch and made of still smouldering volcanic rock.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit with an attack using this maul, the target takes an extra 2d6 fire damage. It sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once Eldfjall reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
You gain resistance to fire damage.
Eldfjall has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn.

Earthen Grasp. As an action, you can cast {@spell maximilian's earthen grasp|XGE} (save DC 17) without needing to concentrate on it and you can use its features as bonus actions. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.
Fire Rune. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 2 charges and invoke a {@optfeature fire rune|TCE} (DC 17) on that attack.
Powerful Blow. (requires attunement by a barbarian) While you are raging, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend one charge and knock the target {@condition prone}.

Raging Heat. (requires attunement by a barbarian) As a bonus action, while you are raging, you can expend 2 charges and deal {@damage 2d6} fire damage to each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you. In addition, all affected creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

item.name: Elderberry Cloak
entries: This cloaks appears to be made out of leaves with elderberries sprinkled all over it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The Elderberry cloak functions as a {@item insignia of claws|HotDQ} and a {@item nature's mantle|TCE}.
In addition, you gain the ability to turn into unaligned monstrosities using your wild shape feature. All other restrictions still apply as normal.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once the Elderberry Cloak reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The cloak becomes a {@item insignia of claws|HotDQ|+2 insignia of claws} and a {@item +1 moon sickle|TCE}.
You gain resistance to poison damage.
The cloak has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn.

Protection from Energy. As an action, you can cast {@spell protection from energy} without needing to concentrate on it, but it only lasts for 1 minute. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.
Wild Mask. As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges and instantly regain one use of your wild shape feature.
Step of the Wild When you use your wild shape feature, you can expend 1 charge and magically teleport up to 30 ft. before assuming your wild shape.

item.name: Emblem of Golden Bones
entries: The Emblem can be used as a spellcasting focus.

As an action while holding the emblem, you can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell requiring no material components to summon a {@creature magma mephit}, {@creature smoke mephit} or {@creature steam mephit} (your choice) without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Essence of Hew
entries: This little vial of oil has to be applied to *Hew*. In Order to restore *hews* original power all four viles have to be applied.

item.name: Glacier
entries: This bow is made out of white wood with a silvery string and it is cold to the touch.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit with an attack using this bow, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} cold damage. Using this bow under water doesn't impose disadvantage.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once Glacier reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: THe bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
You gain resistance to cold damage.
The bow has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.
Sleet Storm. As an action, you can cast {@spell sleet storm} (save DC 17) without needing to concentrate on it. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.

Frozen Solid. When you hit a creature with Glacier, you can expend 2 charges and try to freeze the target in place. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition petrified} until the end of your next turn, but instead of resistance to bludgeoning and fire damage it gains Vulnerability to bludgeoning and fire damage. The condition ends early if it takes any fire damage.
Frigid Air As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges and cause the air around you to become freezing dealing {@damage 3d6} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you.

item.name: Hat of the Harpy
entries: This masterfully crafted silk hat has a large purple feather on its side.

entries.name: Luring Song.
entries: While you wear the hat, as a bonus action, you can sing a magical melody. One humanoid or giant of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear the song must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. You must take a bonus action on your subsequent turns to continue singing. You can stop singing at any time. The song ends if you are incapacitated. While {@condition charmed} this way, a target is {@condition incapacitated}. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from you, the target must move on its turn toward you by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than you, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until the dawn of the next day.

item.name: Haul
entries: This axe appears to be made of gold and holds a glob of radiant light in its head.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit with an attack using this axe, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage. It sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: Once Haul reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: THe bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
You gain resistance to necrotic damage.
The cloak has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn.
Aura of Vitality. As an action, you can cast {@spell aura of vitality} without needing to concentrate on it. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.
Blessed Strike. When you make an attack roll with the axe, you can expend 2 charges of the axe to give yourself a +10 for the roll.
Stored Divinity. (requires attunement by a cleric or paladin) As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges of Haul and instantly regain one use of your channel divinity feature.

Holy Radiance. (requires attunement by a cleric or paladin) As a bonus action, you can expend 2 charges of the axe and emit a bright blinding light from it. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

item.name: Ring of Astonishing Intelligence
entries: While wearing this amulet, your Intelligence score and Intelligence score maximum increases by 3.

item.name: Hew
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-evil alignment
entries: This battleaxe appears to be made of simple iron. It is, however, imbued with a powerful magic making the axe as durable as adamantite. Hew was created long ago to stop Mhecmunas and destroy his philactery.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: Hew is a magic weapon that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The axe also functions as a {@item sword of sharpness|PHB}.

entries.name: Benefical Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the axe, you gain the following benefits:

items.entry: you can cast {@spell remove curse} from it.
you gain a +2 bonus to constitution saving throws.
you can't be {@condition frightend}, {@condition petrified}, or {@condition stunned}.

entries.name: Lumberjack
entries: Any hit with Hew against an evil plant creature or an object made of wood becomes a critical hit and deals maximum damage.

entries.name: Lich Bane
entries: Hew deals an extra {@dice 3d6} radiant damage when the wielder hits an undead creature and you gain advantage on saving throws against spells cast by liches.

item.name: Staff of the Withered
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: This crooked staff is carved from a dead willow branch and topped with a pitch black crystal orb. The orb was once an artifact of its own that could neutralize any poison in its presence, but it has long since been corrupted by Mhecmunas. Sometimes the fade image of a skull can be seen inside the orb. This image belongs to the orbs original owner, an ancient archdruid, who was imprisoned inside the orb.

items.entry: Your proficiency bonus for Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) and Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) checks is doubled.
You can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition petrified}, or {@condition stunned}.
Nonmagical plant within 5 feet of you wither and die.
Magical plants and plant creatures with a challenge rating of 2 or lower avoid you.
You can wield the staff as a [@item +3 quarterstaff} that deals an extra {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Invoke Curse
entries: The Staff of the Withered has 3 charges and regains all of expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (using your spell save DC) or be cursed. While cursed this way, the target suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} and starts to decay, taking {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns. A {@spell greater restoration}, {@spell remove curse}, or similar spell ends the curse on the target.

entries.name: The Withered
entries: The soul of the imprisoned archdruid empowers the staff. Each time a creature other than Mhecmunas expends any of the staff's charges, there is a 50 percent chance that the soul tries to possess the staff wielder. The wielder must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be possessed, becoming an NPC under the DM's control. If the intruding life force is targeted by magic such as a {@spell dispel evil and good} spell, it becomes trapped in the staff once more. Once it takes control of another creature, the insane spirit of the archdruid attempts to destroy the staff.

entries.name: Destroying the Staff
entries: A creature in possession of the staff can use an action to break it over one knee or a solid surface. The staff is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 132 ({@dice 24d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the staff is destroyed, the soul of the archdruid is released to the afterlife. Where it goes is anyone's guess. Casting the staff into a {@item sphere of annihilation} destroys both the staff and the Life force trapped within it. The staff doesn't explode if destroyed in this manner, but its destruction causes the sphere to be destroyed as well.

legendaryGroup.name: Mhecmunas
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Mhecmunas can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; Mhecmunas can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Mhecmunas rolls a d8 and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If he has no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.

Mhecmunas targets one creature he can see within 30 feet of him. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the lich to the target. Whenever the lich takes damage, the target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the lich takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round or until the lich or the target is no longer in the lich's lair.

Mhecmunas chooses up to three creature he can see within 30 feet of him. Each creature must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage and 33 (6d10) necrotic damage and is restrained. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not restrained. As an action, a creature can try to free itself or another creature within its reach, doing so with a successful DC 189 Strength (Athletics) check. Mhecmunas or his Phylactery regain hit points equal to half of the inflicted necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
headerEntries: While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Hag Coven
entries: When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.

A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.

trait.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
entries: A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes {@dice 3d10} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} for 24 hours.

A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while {@condition blinded}. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

action.name: Invisible Passage
entries: The hag magically turns {@condition invisible} until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Aywin is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Marwan has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Villainous Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Aywin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Aywin carries an {@item amulet of health}, a {@item +3 hide armor} and a {@item +1 quarterstaff}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The Aywin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the Aywin to sleep.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Aywin has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain his concentration on a spell. When Aywin could make an opportunity attack, he can use his reaction to cast a spell, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only one creature.

action.name: Aura of Decay {@recharge 6}
entries: Aywin can force each creature within 10 feet of him to make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} and Aywin regains hit points equal to half the inflicted damage. His witherling gains this feature as well.

action.name: Withering Shape (2/long rest)
entries: Aywin can summon a witherling within 60 feet of him. Where the witherling appears, each creature in a 10-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw or take 7 necrotic damage. The witherling stays for a duration of 1 minute, Aywin dismisses it as a bonus action, its hit points are reduce to zero, or Aywin uses this feature again. In combat, the witherling shares Aywins initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after his. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless Aywin take a bonus action on his turn to command it to take one of the actions in its stat block or the Dash, Disengage, Help, Hide, or Search action.

action.name: +1 Quaterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit ({@hit 11} to hit with {@spell shillelagh}), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage or 10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage with {@spell shillelagh} or if wielded with two hands.

bonus.name: Fey Step {@recharge 5}
entries: Aywin can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Immediately before Aywin uses his Fey Step, each creature of his choice that he can see within 5 feet of him takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Aura of Decay
entries: Aywin uses his aura of decay feature. This use of the feature does not inflict {@condition exhaustion}.

legendary.name: Fey Step
entries: Aywin uses his fey step feature.

Aywin once was a humble and kind young eladrin who found his way into the material plane due to an accident with a scroll of plane shift. Separated from his sisters, Shanna and Freya, he found an almost withered seed and planted it. This seed, however, was corrupted by Mhecmunas, who corrupted Aywin in the process. Now loyal to Mhecmunas, Aywin serves his new master by corrupting nature and spreading the essence of Mhecmunas over the world.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Chessa is a 16th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attacks). Chessa has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Chessa is carrying an {@item Amulet of Extraordinary Wisdom|witheringFury}, a {@item Cloak of Stepping|WitheringFury} and {@item Haul|WitheringFury}.

trait.name: Divine Strike
entries: Once on each of her turns when Chessa hits a creature with a weapon attack, she can cause the attack to deal an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target.

trait.name: Guided Strike
entries: When Chessa makes an attack roll, she can use her Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Chessa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Chessa has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain her concentration on a spell. When Chessa could make an opportunity attack, she can use her reaction to cast a spell, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only one creature.

trait.name: Bloody Action
entries: Immediately after Chessa has lost more than half of her hit points, she causes the following effect:

All pillars in the room emit a bright flash of light, forcing all creature, hostile to Chessa, to make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Disrupt Life.
entries: Chessa uses her Channel Divinity. Each living creature within 20 feet of Chessa must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Haul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

bonus.name: War Priest (6/day)
entries: When Chessa uses the Attack action, she can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Spell
entries: Chessa cast a cantrip or a spell of 3rd-level or lower that has a casting time of one action.

legendary.name: Haul
entries: Chessa makes one melee attack using haul.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life
entries: Chessa uses her Disrupt Life feature.

legendary.name: Chessa
entries: Chessa uses her Cloak of Stepping.

Long ago, Chessa was a reputable cleric of Torm, a god of courage. She helped to defeat Mhecmunas, when he threatend to destroy the world and was later buried with an essence of hew. Recently, she was reanimated by the withered eladrin and follower of Mhecmunas Marwan in order to ensure the essence of hew stays in the grave. Chessa doesn't want to be used as a tool of Mhecmunas, but can not resist her orders.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Cinder's spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit +3} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Cinder carries 3 flasks of alchemist's fire.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The cinder deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cinder that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the cinder doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Alchemist's Fire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Cinder can take a bonus action on each of his turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide or Use an Object action, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check or use thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that Cinder can see hits her with an attack, she can use her reaction to halve the attack's damage against her.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skum makes two Mind-Breaking Touch attacks.

action.name: Mind-Breaking Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws until the end of the skum's next turn.

action.name: Psychic Gaze
entries: the dreamer targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Corrosive Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Corrosive Spittle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Errich is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). Errich has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Errich carries a {@item green dragon scale mail} and a {@item staff of withering}.

trait.name: Fungal Body
entries: Any critical hit against Errich counts as a normal hit instead, unless he's {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: Errich can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than him.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Errich roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Villainous Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the errich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Bloody Action
entries: Immediately after Errich has lost more than half of his hit points, he causes the following effect: Errich gains the effects of his Symbiotic Entity feature until his hit points are reduced to 0 and he regains 20 temporary hit points at the start of each of his turns.

action.name: Symbiotic Entity (2/long rest)
entries: Errich can awaken the spores in his body and gain 56 temporary hit points. Until he loses all these temporary hit points, he gain the following benefits:
When Errich deal his Halo of Spores damage, he rolls the damage die a second time and adds it to the total.
Errichs melee weapon attacks deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage to any target they hit.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

bonus.name: Spreading Spores
entries: While Errichs Symbiotic Entity feature is active, he can hurl spores up to 30 feet away. Where they swirl in a 10-foot cube for 1 minute. The spores disappear early if he use this feature again, if he dismiss them as a bonus action, or if his Symbiotic Entity feature is no longer active. Whenever a creature moves into the cube or starts its turn there, that creature takes Errichs Halo of Spores damage, unless the creature succeeds on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. A creature can take this damage no more than once per turn. While the cube of spores persists, Errich can't use his Halo of Spores reaction.

reaction.name: Fungal Infestation (5/long rest)
entries: If a beast or a humanoid that is Small or Medium dies within 10 feet of Errich, he can use his reaction to animate it, causing it to stand up immediately with 1 hit point. The creature uses the zombie stat block in the Monster Manual. It remains animate for 1 hour, after which time it collapses and dies. In combat, the zombie's turn comes immediately after Errichs. It obeys his mental commands, and the only action it can take is the Attack action, making one melee attack.

reaction.name: Halo of Spores
entries: When a creature Errich can see moves into a space within 10 feet of him or starts its turn there, he can use his reaction to deal {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to that creature unless it succeeds on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw.

monster.name: Fomorian Zombie
languages: understands Giant and Undercommon but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is fire, radiant, or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The zombie magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity. The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.
The uppeer body of a dead fomorian, reanimated by foul magic.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Garone is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks or, spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks if he is using his wand). Garone has the following artificer spells prepared:

trait.name: Arcane Advantage
entries: Once per turn, Garone can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage to a creature he hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of Garone and that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Army Arcana
entries: When Garone casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, he can choose himself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

trait.name: Infused Items
entries: Garone carries a repeating {@item musket}, an enhanced defense {@item breastplate}, an enhanced wand and a {@item brooch of shielding}. All those items lose there magical properties four days after Garone died.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on Garones ranged weapon attack rolls. His ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. Before he makes an attack with a ranged weapon that he is proficient with, Garone can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, he adds +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Villainous Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Garone fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scorching Ray (4/long rest)
entries: While Garone wields his musket, he can cast {@spell scorching ray} without expanding a spell slot.

reaction.name: Flash of Genius
entries: When Garone or another creature he can see within 30 feet of him makes an ability check or a saving throw, he can use his reaction to add a +4 bonus to the roll.

The aspiring hobgoblin warchief and artificer Garone recently came to the North Sword Coast in order to claim the territory left behind by the crackmaw tribe. He set up cmap in the old shrine of savras a few miles south of conyberry. Garone is using the ruins of conyberry to set up ambushes.

trait.name: Eldritch Cannon
entries: If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains 7 ({@damage 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Protector
entries: The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of Garones choice within 10 feet of it a number of temporary hit points equal to 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
headerEntries: While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Hag Coven
entries: When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.

A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.

trait.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
entries: A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes {@dice 3d10} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} for 24 hours.

A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while {@condition blinded}. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

action.name: Invisible Passage
entries: The hag magically turns {@condition invisible} until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Ik carries a {@item headband of intellect}

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Ray of Frost
entries: If Ik attacks with his greatsword, he can cast {@spell ray of frost} (5th level, {@hit 6} to hit) as a bonus action.
Ik is an ogre that once found a headband of intellect. He is the right hand man to the frost giant Bribnir.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Karyns spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Karyn is carrying a {@item Cloak of the Manta Ray}, {@item Glacir|WitheringFury}, a {@item Ring of Astonishing Intelligence|WitheringFury} and a {@item +2 Scimitar}.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/lday)
entries: On Karyns turn, she can take one additional action on top of her regular action and a possible bonus action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The karyn can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Arcane Shot {@recharge 4}
entries: Once per turn when Karyn fires a magic arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, she can apply one of her Arcane Shot options to that arrow.

items.name: Piercing Arrow.
items.entry: When she uses this option, Karyn doesn't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

items.name: Bursting Arrow.
items.entry: She imbues her arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after Karyns attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage each.

items.name: Enfeebling Arrow.
items.entry: She weaves necromantic magic into her arrow. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Curving Shot
entries: When Karyn make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, she can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Karyn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mobil
entries: When Karyn uses the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost her extra movement on that turn and when she make a melee attack against a creature, she doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether she hits or not.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on Karyns ranged weapon attack rolls. Her ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. Before she make an attack with a ranged weapon that she is proficient with, Karyn can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, she adds +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Bloody Action
entries: Immediately after Karyn has lost more than half of her hit points, she causes the following effect:

The entire room becomes submerged in water and strong currents begin to flow, forcing all creatures, hostile to Karyn, to make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Karyn makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Glacier
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 15} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: +2 Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/day)
entries: On Karyns turn, she can use a bonus action to regain 21 ({@damage 1d10 + 16}) hit points.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Karyn moves up to half of her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Glacier
entries: Karyn makes one ranged attack using glacier.

legendary.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Karyn cast a spell from her innate spellcasting list.

Karyn once was a member of the guard of the ancient triton settlement Cassiopaia. After her settlement got destroyed by sahuagin raiders, she decided to travel the world above the seas and helped to stop Mhecmunas 800 years ago. Recently, she got reanimated by the druid errich, a henchman of Mhecmunas.

trait.name: Magma Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light in an additional 20 ft..

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 16 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Spit Magma
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Spawn Magmit {@recharge 5}
entries: The Elemental spawns 3 ({@dice 1d6}) Magmits within 20 feet of it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mhecmunas is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Mhecmunas has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Mhecmunas carries a {@item Dancing Longsword} and the {@item Staff of the Withered|WitheringFury}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Mhecmunas fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Mhecmunas' body turns to dust when he drops to 0 hit points, and his equipment is left behind. Mhecmunas gains a new body after {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of Mhecmunas' phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: Mhecmunas has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Bloody Action
entries: Immediately after Mhecmunas has lost more than half of his hit points for the first time, he causes the following effect:

vampiric roots sproud from the ground. Each creature on the ground, that Mhecmunas can see, must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained}. Mhecmunas regains hit points equal to  half of the inflicted necrotic damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Mhecmunas can move through other creatures and objects. He takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Staff (+3 Quarterstaff)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Invoke Curse
entries: While holding the Staff of the Withered, Mhecmunas expends 1 charge from it and targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be cursed. Until the curse is ended, the target suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} and starts to decay, taking {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns. {spell Greater restoration}, {@spell remove curse}, or similar magic ends the curse on the target.

bonus.name: Dancing Longsword
entries: Mhecmunas can use a bonus action to toss this magic sword into the air and speak the command word. When he does so, the sword begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of his choice within 5 feet of it. The sword uses his spell attack modifer to hit and adds his Intelligence modifier to  damage rolls.

While the sword hovers, he can use a bonus action to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of him. As part of the same bonus action, he can cause the sword to attack one creature within 5 feet of it.

bonus.name: Ethereal Jault
entries: As a bonus action, Mhecmunas can magically move up to 30 feet through the ethereal plane.

legendary.name: At-Will Spell
entries: Mhecmunas casts one of his at-will spells.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mhecmunas fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target its immune to Acererak's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 20 feet of Mhecmunas must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Vampiric Roots
entries: Mhecmunas chooses up to three creature he can see within 30 feet of  him. Each creature must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained}. Mhecmunas or his Phylactery regain hit points equal to half of the inflicted necrotic damage.

Mhecmunas was an archlich slain hundreds of years ago by a group of ancient heroes. At times he took pleasure in torturing and killing powerful druids, as well as destroying nature. After Mhecmunas was destroyed, his essence found shelter in the seed of a willow plotting his revenge ever since.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)

footerEntries: For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Mimicry

The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while {@condition blinded}. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

entries: The hag magically turns {@condition invisible} until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with her.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Oomph is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). Oomph has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Oomph is carrying a {@item Ring of Protection}, {@item Blixt|WitheringFury} and a {@item Bracelet of Outstanding Charisma|WitheringFury}.

trait.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: Whenever Ooomph start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, all creatures of his choice that he can see within 10 feet of him take 8 lightning or thunder damage (his choice).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Oomph fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Metamagic
entries: Oomph has 16 sorcery points. He can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when he casts it, unless otherwise noted.

items.name: Distant Spell.
items.entry: When he casts a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, he can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell. When Oomph casts a spell that has a range of touch, he can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.

items.name: Heightend Spell.
items.entry: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

items.name: Quickend Spell.
items.entry: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

trait.name: Bloody Action
entries: Immediately after Oomph has lost more than half of his hit points, he causes the following effect:

Lightning crashes down at Oomph, forcing each creature within 15 feet of him to make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage and is pushed 15 feet away from Oomph in a strait line or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, the next time Oompf deals lightning damage, that damage is maximized.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Oomph can use his action or bonus action to exhale destructive energy. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed in a straight line up to 15 feet away from Oomph.

bonus.name: Tempestous Magic
entries: Oomph can use a bonus action on his turn immediately before or after he casts a spell of 1st level or higher to fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Storms Fury
entries: When Oomph is hit by a melee attack, he can use his reaction to deal 16 lightning damage to the attacker. The attacker must also make a {@dc 19} Strength saving. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from Oomph.

legendary.name: Spell
entries: Oomph casts a cantrip or a spell of 3rd-level or lower that has a casting time of one action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Oompf moves up to half of his speed, without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Oompf uses his breath weapon.

Octavius Otto Maurice Phillip Harrenwell, Oomph for short, was an adventurer over 800 years ago. He was part of the heroes that originally defeated Mhecmunas. After his death he was buried together with his strusted staff blixt and an essence of hew in the howling revine. However, oomph was recently reanimated by errich to serve as a sentry for the essence of hew.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Savalar is a 17th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attacks). Savalar has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Savalar is carrying an emblem of the golden bones, a {@item robe of the archmagi} and a {@item staff of fire}.

trait.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: Savalar can add his Intelligence modifier to the damage roll of any wizard evocation spell he casts.

trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: When Savalar casts an evocation spell that affects other creatures that he can see, he can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: Savalar uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Fire Breath.
items.entry: Savalar exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Weakening Breath.
items.entry: Savalar exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sengos spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Action Surge (1/day)
entries: On Sengos turn, he can take one additional action on top of his regular action and a possible bonus action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When Sengo is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Sengo has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Poisonous Weapons
entries: Sengo always applies a strong poison of paralysis to his weapons before entering combat. If he hits with any weapon attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: On Sengos turn, he can use a bonus action to regain 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) hit points.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on Sengos ranged weapon attack rolls. His ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. Before he makes an attack with a ranged weapon that he is proficient with, sengo can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, he adds +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Skirmisher
entries: Sengo can move up to half his speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of him. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Sengo can deal an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage to one creature he hits with an attack if he has advantage on the attack roll or another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: Sengo has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when he, the target of his attack, or whatever he are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

action.name: +2 Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Sengo can take a bonus action on each of his turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that Sengo can see hits him with an attack, he can use his reaction to halve the attack's damage against him.
A renowned bounty hounter and slaver among the drow, the cold blooded Sengo was hired by the drow settlement in gauntlgrym to capture the adventurers for the murder of the black spider.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}).

action.name: Lightning Bolt  {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental shoots lightning in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A storm elemental is a funneling storm cloud with a vague semblance of a face. Although it likes to race across the ground, picking up dust and debris as it goes, it can also fly and attack from above.

Elementals are incarnations of the elements that make up the universe: air, earth, fire, and water. Though little more than animated energy on their own planes of existence, they can be called on by spellcasters and powerful beings to take shape and perform tasks.

entries.name: Living Elements
entries: On its home plane, an elemental is a bodiless life force. Its dim consciousness manifests as a physical shape only when focused by the power of magic. A wild spirit of elemental force has no desire except to course through the element of its native plane. Like beasts of the Material Plane, these elemental spirits have no society or culture, and little sense of being.

entries.name: Conjured by Magic
entries: Certain spells and magic items can conjure an elemental, summoning it from the Inner Planes to the Material Plane. Elementals instinctively resent being pulled from their native planes and bound into service. A creature that summons an elemental must assert force of will to control it.

entries.name: Bound and Shaped
entries: Powerful magic can bind an elemental spirit into a material template that defines a specific use and function. Invisible stalkers are air elementals bound to a specific form, in the same way that water elementals can be shaped into water weirds.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: An elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Torks

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Torks spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 19}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Torks is carrying a {@item Belt of Stone Giant Strength}, a {@item Cloak of the Mole|WitheringFury} and {@item Eldfjall|WitheringFury}.

trait.name: Brutal Crit
entries: Torks rolls two additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: Torks has advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that he can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, he can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Earth Walk
entries: Torks can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.

trait.name: Feral Senses
entries: Torks has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Torks fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rage
entries: Torks has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. When he makes a melee weapon attack using Strength, he gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Reckless Attack
entries: When Torks makes his first attack on his turn, he can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives him advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until his next turn.

trait.name: Relentless Rage
entries: If Torks drops to 0 hit points and doesn't die outright, he can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw. If Torks succeeds, he drops to 1 hit point instead. Each time he use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5.

trait.name: Storm Aura
entries: Torks emanates a stormy, magical aura. The aura extends 10 feet from him in every direction, but not through total cover. All other creatures in his aura take 5 fire damage each at the start of their turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Torks makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Storm Soul
entries: Torks can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.

action.name: Eldfjall
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage or  19 ({@damage 2d6 + 12}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Raging Storm
entries: Immediately after a creature in Torks aura hits him with an attack , he can force that creature to make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 8 fire damage.

legendaryHeader: Torks can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Torks regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Torks moves up to half of his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Eldfjall
entries: Torks makes one melee attack using Eldfjall.

legendary.name: Shove
entries: Torks shoves one creature within 5 feet of him.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Venomfang can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Venomfang has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Venomfang fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Venomfang makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition spored}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition spored}.

action.name: Spore Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Venomfang exhales poisonous gas and spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The green dragon Venomfang once settled in Thundertree and made the old tower his layer. He was eventually defeated by an adventuring party and fled northeast into Neverwinter Wood. Unfortunately he encountered the remnants of Mhecmunas and got killed. After that he was raised from the dead as a servant for Mhecmunas by the druid Errich.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The witherbeast is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the witherbeast moves at least 15 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the witherbeast fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The witherbeast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If the witherbeast takes damage that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witherhulk makes two tusk attacks.

action.name: Aura of Decay {@recharge 8}
entries: The witherbeast can force each creature within 15 feet of it to make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} and the witherbeast regains hit points equal to half the inflicted damage.

action.name: Withering Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Aura of Decay
entries: The witherbeast uses its aura of decay feature. This use of the feature does not inflict {@condition exhaustion}.

legendary.name: Tusk
entries: The witherbeast makes one tusk attack.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The witherhulk is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witherhulk makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Withering Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The witherling is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Withering Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

spell.name: Dread Meadow
entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range becomes overgrown dark purplish to blackish vegetation, so called dread weed. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration and each creature that starts its turn there or enters the area for the first time and isn't a construct, plant or undead must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature suffers one effect from the following table:

rows: The creature takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for the duration. A {@condition poisoned} creature takes {@damage 1d10} poison damage at the start of each of its turns and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
The creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

The creature becomes {@condition restrained} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition petrified} for the duration. On a successful save, the creature is no longer restrained. If the creature is {@condition petrified} for the full duration of the spell, it stays {@condition petrified} until cured.
